newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent rises as NYMEX hits five-year high.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent rises as NYMEX hits five-year high.

text.p: SIMEX Brent December futures traded to a contract high on Monday, taking their cue from a fresh five-year high on NYMEX crude trading on ACCESS.

NYMEX prompt crude futures traded at $25.86 per barrel on ACCESS -- their highest since hitting $25.85 in New York trading on Friday which broke the five-year high of $25.70 that had stood since April.
November last traded on ACCESS -- an after-hours dealings system -- at $25.85.
Brokers said the ACCESS high prompted SIMEX December Brent to trade at a contract high of $24.65 per barrel, 12 cents higher than the London settlement on Friday of $24.53.
Worries about low heating oil stocks in Europe and the United States, heading into the cold winter season, has reignited a bull run, traders said.
Fighting among Kurdish factions in Iraq and Russian President Boris Yeltsin sacking of his security advisor had added to the bullish tone late last week.
